module.p: a his, her, its is the third person singular possessive determiner, related to the personal pronouns i she, her, it and e he, him, it.
cf. other uses of the particle a.

Examples from Gairm –
Bha i ceud bliadhna a dh’ aois is esan dhà air fhichead. Cha robh e ach mìos no dhà a-mach ás an oilthigh. Bha a nighean a’ fuireachd còmhla rithe. Bha ise ceithir fichead. Shaoil e gu robh a’ chailleach ann an dòigh na bu shunndaiche na a nighean. [......] “Carson nach do bhàsaich thu o chionn leth-cheud bliadhna,” dh’ éigh Màiri. Bha i smaoineachadh air na gnothaichean ud fhathast! “Greas ort leis an tea,” ars a màthair. [...]
She was a hundred years old and him twenty two. He was just a month or two out of the university. Her daughter was living with her. She was eighty. He thought that the old woman was in a way livelier than her daughter. [......] “Why did you not die fifty years ago,” shouted Mary. She was still thinking about those matters! “Hurry up with the tea,” said her mother. [...] td. 169–71, le Iain Mac a’ Ghobhainn feminine

Now these are the names of the children of Israel, which came into Egypt; every man and his household came with Jacob. Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah, Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin, Dan, and Naphtali, Gad, and Asher. And all the souls that came out of the loins of Jacob were seventy souls: for Joseph was in Egypt already. And Joseph died, and all his brethren, and all that generation. Examples from Gairm –
Anns na ràithean ’s na bliadhnachan a tha air thoiseach oirnn, tha fhios gun dig iomadh atharrachadh air Roinn na Gàidhlig sa’ Bh.B.C. Dh’ fhàg Eóghan Mac-a- phì a sheula fhéin air an Roinn sin, agus air a’ Bh.B.C. an Albainn gu h-iomlan, agus air dha a nis a dhreuchd a leigeil dheth, dh’ iarramaid taing a thoirt dha airson gach seirbhis a thug e do ar cànain, is ghuidheamaid dhà saorsainn is toileachas ’na shaorsa, agus obair ás ùr anns na raointean a thaghas e. Anns an aon fhacal chuireamaid fàilte air Fread MacAmhlaidh a tha a’ togail an eallaich. Tha sinn eòlach air a ghuth agus air obair, agus ghuidheamaid gach soirbheachadh leis.
During the seasons and the years that are ahead of us, it is known that many changes will come to the Gaelic Department of the BBC. Ewan MacPhee has left his own stamp on that Department, and on the BBC in Scotland as a whole, and after him now giving up his job, we would ask for thanks to be given him for all the service he has given to our language, and wish him liberty and pleasure in his freedom, and new work in the areas that he will choose. In the same word we would welcome Fred MacAulay who is taking up the burden. We know his voice and his work, and we would wish him every success. td. 297, ‘Air an Spiris’
Bha beagan airgid aige ’s mar sin chaith e a bheatha a’ sgrìobhadh, gun feum aige air obair eile a dhèanamh.
He had a little money and therefore he devoted his life to writing, without the need to do other work. td. 103 reflexive ie. himself’s
